alert.note: Alert for Chesterfield; Kershaw; Southern Lancaster (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 23 at 1:11PM EDT by NWS Columbia
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Lancaster, northwestern Chesterfield and north central Kershaw Counties through 145 PM EDT... At 111 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Buford, or 11 miles east of Lancaster, moving northeast at 55 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Pageland, Kershaw, Heath Springs, Westville, Mt Pisgah, Buford, Jefferson, Ruby, Mount Croghan, Chesterfield Ruby Middle School, High Point Fire Station, Tradesville, Forty Acre Rock Preserve, Taxahaw, Kershaw Correctional Institution and Central High School. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
